Some photos look great and some photos you can see there is a lot of extra material. I received a lot of compliments wearing this dress. I will rent it again in an xs, maybe I'll buy that one.
In love with this dress! I wore it with a belt and without, with birkenstocks and with cowboy boots. Loose, flowing free spirited dress. This one's staying with me!

I thought I could wear as a prairie dress but its completely see-through so you would need to wear as a layered piece but its a dress so jeans or a skirt under would look silly. Only a slip that was the exact cut or if it had lining it could work.
This was very flowy as I was expecting but probably wouldn't look great without a belt. It was a bit long as well and low cut.
The material has quite a bit of weight to it, which I liked for wearing layered with a printed army jacket.
Absolutely loved this & I ended up buying it. I get compliments every time I wear it. Definitely oversized and flown but gorgeous fabric and so fun to wear!
I preferred to wear this with a tan belt as the dress unbelted is formless and runs very big. It’s a bit sheer, so nude underwear are a must.
Lots of fabric, but cute

Grandma vibes, but make it fashion. Wore this with some otk suede boots and lived my best grandma life. Got lots of compliments despite feeling like I was drowning in fabric. Granted I’m very petite, but keep in mind this dress runs extremely large! Would have kept it if it fit a little better.
Could wear this dress multiple times a week. It's an oversized style & a belt is needed if you want a more fitted look. Perfect piece to go from dressed down to dressed up!

links_reviews_title: My favorite piece in my Nuuly!
links_reviews_text: I am going to get the red version because I loved the way this fit! Definitely need to wear it with a small waist belt, super cute! If you are on the fence, don’t be, this was my favorite item in my Nuuly! I wore it so many times last month and got compliments everywhere i went. It runs big but I usually wear a medium and I am happy I got the medium.
Really gorgeous dress. It has a little structure despite being more a mumu, but would recommend wearing with a belt.

links_reviews_title: Runs large, should have gotten a medium
links_reviews_text: I can tell this dress is lovely, but I got the large and should have gotten a smaller size. When it’s too big it looks like a nightdress. I am a thick gal but mostly in the butt and thighs so deciding dress sizes is trickier for me - this is one I should have sized down, for sure.
I love this dress. I wore it to Thanksgiving and it was such a hit! It's really beautiful! I wore it belted, because it is quite "tent"-y without something to cinch it. Sad to give this one back!
This dress is so gorgeous. The material is so flowy and luxurious feeling. It drapes great without belt, but also looks really cute belted! It has become my most favorite dress!

I wore this more times than I can count throughout my month of having it! It runs very large. I usually wear a 16 and the large was perfect on me. Oversized and roomy but I wasn't drowning in it. The slip definitely runs much smaller than the dress so I wore it with my own slip or with black tights and a black turtleneck under it. I felt like I could wear this in so many different ways depending on the weather. This is a must have!

I really wanted to love this dress, and the feel and print of the fabric are actually really nice, but the fit is wacky! it was HUGE even when I sized down more than a full size, and there just wasn't anything cute I could figure out to do with the extra bulk that looked right. belting it was a slight improvement, but because the sizing is so very generous, even that left some unsightly bulging that added a lot of weight to my frame that looked frumpy instead of cute. and because the sleeves are so voluminous, trying to put on a structured jacket or sweater on top to tone down the volume of the dress itself wasn't even feasible. alas, I tried it on once, tried in sincerity to experiment with how I might wear it, but never did because I felt like I was swimming in it.
Though it is supposed to fit loose, it was more mumu-esque than chic and definitely requires some sort of belt to tie it together.

Loved wearing this dress (with a belt) - it was very long on me, but still looked cute at ankle length once I put the belt on. Lots of fabric, so very fun and swingy to wear. The wrists were a little tight, but otherwise this was super comfy and I loved wearing it out. Got compliments!

LOVE this dress - got so many compliments when wearing, it's the perfect transitional fall/spring dress and easy to layer. Wore it with a belt to give more shape. True to size. My favorite item I got!
Love this dress! Wore it belted too. Unfortunately it came missing the slip lining, but luckily I had an spare one to use. Flowy + pretty.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful print and twirling opportunities! Runs large, like most Free People dresses
links_reviews_text: I loved having this dress! It did run rather large, as many Free People dresses tend to. If I didn't wear a belt it looked pretty frumpy, but add a belt and it was super cute. I got a ton of compliments! It fit much longer on me than the model, but I'm 5' 4" ish.
The material is so dreamy. Can be worn for a daytime look or special occasion. I loved wearing it belted. It runs super big, I’d suggest sizing down 1 or 2 but even the large was beautiful belted.
I love this dress so much and got so many compliments! It fits true to size but I would size down if you're in between 2 sizes since it's a lot of fabric. Wear with a belt and you're good to go!

i really wanted to like this dress, especially based off so many other reviews on nuuly and on free people's website. i got xs based off others saying it runs big and it really is like a tent. i even tried belting it and it did nothing for me but make me look wider and bigger than i am. I think this dress is for someone much taller than me (5'3), otherwise you drown in it.

This dress is very "Free People". Bohemian, girly, dreamy.... It definitely has a lot of material so it is probably not suited for very petite women. I only wore it once but loved how feminine it made me feel.
Wore this to a wedding in Tucson last weekend and it was perfect! A little big but I belted it low with a nude leather belt, and received a lot of compliments. So cute! I would totally rent it again.
Got lots of compliments.
This dress was really cute! Was very wide and baggy so I recommend wearing a belt but other than that I really liked it! Wore it to work and out to dinner. Perfect for summer.
Picked this for a vacation for Italy and it did not disappoint. Super cute with lots of drama. Loved it. Only wished it was a little smaller.
I tried this dress on at FP, and have been dreaming about it ever since. The only thing that kept me from buying it was the price tag. Thanks to Nuuly, I’ll be wearing this dress all month long!
I'm usually a size M/L, but a small fit perfectly. Definitely needs a belt, unless you want large, baggy, boho vibes

links_reviews_title: Pretty and feminine, with so many different ways to make it your own.
links_reviews_text: Like many of the Free People styles, this runs a bit oversized. I'm typically a size Medium in most brands, but I rented a Small in this dress. TBH, I could have probably opted for an XS. But let's not get ahead of ourselves! When I first put it on, I wasn't very impressed. It was a little too much fabric for me. But then I cinched it in with a concho belt. It looked so good! The waist definition drew attention to the great dolman sleeves. I also did not use the slip that accompanied it because it hit me above the neckline of the dress. Instead I wore it with a bralette and nude bike shorts. It's barely sheer, so this worked and was not too risque for work. I am definitely going to rent it in the second color next month. I am taking off one star because the fabric was very unbreathable and I smelled a little ripe by the end of the day.
Inner slip is TTS but outer dress is huge, consider sizing way down and wearing your own slip. Material wasn’t as soft as expected.

This dress would likely look perfect on someone tall and slender. But it felt frumpy on me. I’m usually a L/XL and sized down to a M - still had plenty of room. I was able to make this work by wearing it with a denim vest/jacket or by belting it.

This dress is cute and easy to style! I’ve worn it a handful of ways since I’ve received it. The fit is true to size but the elastic in the sleeve is a bit tight. I have indents on my wrists/arms from wearing it.
Good transition to fall dress. You will definitely want to belt it as it is shapeless, but once belted and with chunky shoes it looks great.

links_reviews_title: I would sleep in this, it is so comfy.
links_reviews_text: Got a million compliments on this dress and loved every day I wore it. It does run big and can be a little heavy for a hot day but overall, an amazing pick. The pic makes it look almost like a high low which isn't accurate, it is a true maxi.

This was the dress I was most excited to wear. It was even more beautiful in person! However, it does run large. I normally wear a Large but ordered the medium based on the way it fit the model, but it was still big. It was also long (I’m 5”2 for reference). Still, would definitely recommend.
flowy and cute. recommend a waist belt to make it extra wearable

links_reviews_title: Comfy, versatile dress that can be dressed up/down and works across seasons
links_reviews_text: Loved the print! Goes with black or brown. Could be dressed up or down and worn with sandals in the summer or boots in colder months. Would also be cute with a sweater or jacket layered over. Definitely maxi length on me, but I'm 5'1". Comes with a slip that has adjustable straps, but you could also wear a body suit or your own slip underneath or rock without for a really sheer look.
Lived in it b/c I got so many compliments – the only thing missing on this dress is pockets ;)

I have a pretty big bust and getting into the dress was pretty hard. And for me since I need clothes to shape me, this didn't work for me. I tried wearing a belt with it to sinch my waist, but it was pretty uncomfortable for me. I can definitely imagine someone with long legs and not too much of a chest looking fab in this one!!
Loved this dress! Was super comfortable - ended up styling with a black belt and sandals.
This dress was not for me. I felt like I was wearing a nightgown. If you like ruffles go for it but it was not my style at all. The fabric and fit was great though!

Such a delicate dress! It's definitely oversized but that's how it's intended to be. I'm 5'1" so unbelted it hits right at my ankles. I wore it with slides and I love how it flows when I walk. It's cute belted too to show a bit more form and ankle

Great top! It fit well on my wider shoulders, and I liked the tie front. It definitely is cropped, so you need fully high waisted pants if you want to wear this to work. The fabric was a nice texture, would be great for summer.
A little short, but cute!
Boxier fit, but runs small

This shirt fits fine, but I kinda wish it either didn't have the tie, or that the tie could actually be used to tie the shirt tight so it's not boxy at the waist. Not super flattering, just kinda meh.

I'm typically an XS in shirts, and got an XS in this. It fit perfectly, but I didn't love it. The material feels kind of cheap and the tie is very limp and kind of unflattering where it hits. I would've liked it better without the tie. Perfectly fine shirt, but not the best quality!

links_reviews_title: Tiny, even for a small chest
links_reviews_text: I wore this once for a few hours and then had to change. Even with a small chest I found it really unflattering and squished whatever chest I do have down. Definitely size up.

links_reviews_title: Cute but brighter and smaller than pictured
links_reviews_text: It fit well except around the bust and I am a 32B (so not very large!) - the thread holding the bust together split a little trying to take it off (sorry Nuuly!). However, it wasn't noticeable so still wore it once for a date night out. But I would have gotten a lot more everyday wear out of it if it was a little less bright. It's definitely a lot brighter than pictured - really is a true Bubblegum pink! Otherwise super cute!
So cute!
I love this sweater! The pattern and colors are amazing and everyone at my work loved it too. Very oversized! Unfortunately for me it felt a little itchy. Only wore it once

links_reviews_title: Very wide, but pattern and material cozy and fun
links_reviews_text: Definitely a statement sweater!! Loved it, however very wide, and pockets add a little puff which contributes to the wideness. Overall recommend!
the ultimate cozy sweater
I loved this piece! I got a lot of compliments on it:)
I tend to love a baggy look and while it was oversized, it worked well with jeans and jumpsuits. The colors are fanatastic!
It's a very beautiful item, but I felt short in it-I am 5'4".
Sweater was pretty but it was just too much sweater for me. For those who like super large sweater, this one is for you! I only wore once as I just felt it was not flattering for my pear shape.
Great print. Warm. Pockets - always a plus. But M/L was wayyyyy too big, and not in a cute oversized way.
Love this oversized (HUGE) sweater coat. It was fun to wear and easy to throw on over an outfit. Great piece for a rental!

Gorgeous sweater! A little bit itchy if you wear it with a short sleeve tee, but if you layer it's fine. It arrived a little bit worn, but I feel that's to be expected with seater items. I would recommend to anyone!

links_reviews_title: Over-sized and over-patterned and I loved it
links_reviews_text: This over-sized sweater coat is as big and colorful as you would imagine. My family thought it was too wacky, but I loved it and wore it all the time. It was more suited for around the house and out running errands (I could even wear it instead of a coat and I live in New England where it is full-on snowy winter right now), but I did wear it to work on a casual day (and I work in a casual environment). Too expensive to buy, but soft and cozy for winter.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous and fun cardigan, but size WAY down!
links_reviews_text: Like other reviews said, you NEED to get the smallest size - I usually wear L/XL in jackets but ordered the XS/S and it's still loose! It's an absolutely gorgeous cardigan, though - I paired it with jeans and a simple back tee and got compliments all day! The photos don't do it justice; there are so many beautiful colors and details in the knit that you only notice up-close. I won't be keeping it, but it is so much fun to wear for the month.
Waited a few weeks for the small in this sweater- and it was still huge..also the pockets hit at your hips..adding to the oversized look. So disappointed
This sweater got me lots of compliments because of its unique pattern. However it's not very flattering because of how HUGE it is. And the material is pretty itchy, I only ended up wearing it once.
Loved it, but it was really oversized, probably would have kept it in the smaller size!
Little too big!

If I tie it the shoulder line won’t sit well on my shoulders. If I don’t tie it the neckline is way too low and too open. I tried to wear it backwards and it kinda works. The opening around my legs are too big too, can’t wear out without pants. The material is nice.

Fiery, poppy red color flattering on everyone. Fun, romantic ruffles and "swing" fit. As others pointed out, a little less boho-chic than expected w the dramatic, plunging v-neckline. More appropriate for a flirty date night.
I got this for a trip that was cancelled due to Coronavirus and it was just too cold where I am to wear it! Super cute though. Definitely runs large size down at least a few sizes

this was a cute addition in my second trimester. The only thought i have is that its super low cut so you almost need a cami of some type underneath and the ends of the strings on the front of garment, while fashionable, are extremely heavy leading to the strings almost like dangerously flying around as you turn and move.

I sized down to an XS after seeing review that it ran large but could have done with an XXS too! it was still cute though, just more of an oversized baggy dress look. I didnt get a chance to wear it, which was a bummer. the color is very flattering

Obsessed. So cute, so cozy! Worked for a day by the pool, and with the right pair of shoes, worked great for a nice dinner. The dress definitely runs large, but on purpose because of the type of dress it is. I am usually a medium, but ordered a small and it was the perfect, flowy fit. It also has roomy arms, so for those who love a flowy dress, but can't stand when the arms are tight, this is for you!
This was one of my favorite rentals! It's a little bit sheer, but nothing shapewear can't fix. I was worried it would be too short on me, but it wasn't at all. I am considering buying!

links_reviews_title: Adorable, comfy and lovely color - I'm 7 Months Preggo!
links_reviews_text: Adorable dress and super comfy! I'm 7 months pregnant and I paired it with a pair of rain boots and a cute scarf and I got TONS of compliments!
I wanted to love this dress, but for me it was too much material and too flowy. I it's made well and a pretty color but just did not flatter me because of how much material there was.

Super cute as a beach cover-up. A little low-cut/short for anything else unless you're wearing a bandeau. I usually wear a small and the XS was perfect - still baggy but that's how the dress is supposed to fit.

This petite gal is to shooting my shot with Free People and hoping it'll fit, but this time I was out of luck. This dress is not meant for a petite frame. I was able to make it work with a belt and totally change the structure, but didn't end up wearing it.
I just didn't love the fit of this. I know it's supposed to be oversized...but it was also kinda long on me. The combination was not particularly cute.
I rented this in pink as well. Fit is loose and comfy. I wore with some doc marten boots and felt comfortable . Larger fit .
Not for short girls :)

This dress was really pretty and great quality. However, it was HUGE. I normally am a M/L, but could have done ana XS in this one. I safety pinned in it half, so I didn’t waste a rental piece! But, still got compliments!
I wore it as a cover up on my vacation and it was great. super lightweight and the color was bright and perfect!

Loved the silhouette and fabric but the fit was too big to make it work -- even at 36 weeks pregnant. Felt like I was wearing a big bag and a belt didn't work to create structure. Try sizing down 2 sizes if you can. I usually wear a small but x-small was still too big.
Its super huge. and A lot longer than expected. Kinda reminded me of a maternity dress
I love this dress! It’s big so a great beach coverup or chic with a belt. The sleeves are huge so I just used some hair elastics to bunch them up a bit 😉

Overall a really cute boho style dress! Runs very large, so size down. Perfect for early maternity. Currently 15 weeks pregnant and still hid the bump easily. For those of us with a large bust, it works well but certainly gives off a more cleavage than I prefer. I decided to wear a black slip underneath, with flat black boots and black tights.

Even being 5'9", I went with a small due to the reviews. It fit very well- it hit a bit above my knees like the model shown and was also long enough in the sleeves. It is VERY low cut though- I couldn't wear a bra with it because it kept peeking out on the sides.

links_reviews_title: Really quite oversized. Order one size down.
links_reviews_text: Wore it with a lace cami for Valentine’s Day with suede boots. Got compliments!
Never wore bc ran large

I loved this mini. I didn't realize it was so low plunging, but hello! I wore it to a concert with a pair of leggings. I felt cute and fashionable. Definitely brunch or evening worthy when you want to look cute and sexy.
Tried this on and I could’ve fit another person in it with me! I got the XS because of reviews and it was still too large.

links_reviews_title: Way too big and I’m not nearly a small!
links_reviews_text: Got a small based off reviews and it was still really big and very low cut. I had to wear a top under it so I didn’t have my boobs hanging out! I thought it looked cute and wore to an event. It was in the photos that I noticed I looked like I was wearing a big garbage bag. If I had an XXS maybe would be great. I normally wear a large and like my clothes baggy.

links_reviews_title: Ahhh i dont want to give this back
links_reviews_text: This dress is the perfect little Stevie nicks night on the town dress , i got it in black in case i didn't like the item i knew i could make it work . But its perfect just as every review says its runs large i got a small and could have used a XS . But the small length was good for me and im only 5 2 .

links_reviews_title: Pretty but not for my shape
links_reviews_text: I saw the reviews that if runs big, but seriously, it was past my knees. I was also overly optimistic that this cut might work on my 5'2" pear shape. I was looking for something that didn't show my pregnancy. I had images of looking vibrant and effortless like the model, but I kinda just looked like a toddler in an adult shirt. The color and texture was really fun. On the right shape, this is a great dress.
Too loose in the wrong places. Would be cute on someone taller.
Love this dress, I have rented it in two colors now. Runs super big, got a M the first time and a S the second time and I usually wear a large.
Flirty, fun, sexy cute! Should buy it now that I think about it.... :)
The red isn’t as vibrant as the pic and the drop waist was awkward on me. I sized down. Didn’t end up wearing this piece out.
If I were going to order again I think I would go with an XS, but the S was still cute (needed a belt though). The fabric was heavier than I expected but I liked the boho vibe.
This dress was perfect for a dress up dinner party for Stevie Nicks vibes. Loved the dress but the sleeves were a bit long for my frame.
This would be better on someone taller. This was very low cut. Couldn’t even wear it...

I tried this dress on a couple times but because of the low cut and the sheerness I ended up wearing something else from my Nuuly bag. If I had planned better, I know I would have had a good time wearing it. It does run large and you will need to plan to wear something under it or at least a fun black bra because it will be seen!
I threw this in my Nuuly expecting it to be “meh” but I LOVED it! I wore it as a beach coverup and then threw on a belt and felt chic and cute! I loved it!
Normally a M/8 but ordered a small per the other reviews, it still swallowed me. Wore it with a belt and cami underneath and that helped, but otherwise would not have worked on its own.
Want to be the firecracker or the night? Pick this dress! So firey and cute. I received So many compliments.

I rented this for a vacation, and it was so pretty! I will definitely be renting again once warmer weather rolls around. It runs large - I’m usually a S/M and ordered an XS. It was still very loose but fit just as I wanted it to.
Pretty dress but runs big and really wide sleeves
This is a great dress. I know free people so I should have known better and sized way down. This dress was too big in a S but I think an XS would have been perfect. I might size done and rent again.
A bit big, but great for Xmas!

Previously rented and wore it a ton - so this time, I rented it again at a smaller size for the holidays. Loved how easy this dress it. It's so loose that it's super comfy to throw on but still look nice. Even two sizes down, I had to wear a cami underneath it - but I don't think that messed up the look. Def size down 1 or 2 sizes though!

links_reviews_title: Way too big, doesn’t look good at all.
links_reviews_text: It was like an oversized bag. Not flattering
I purchased the dress! I love it. Dress it up with heals or down with booties. Great dress!

I’m a huge fan of loose “sack” dresses, but this one is very big! Definitely size down. I needed to wear with a belt or it swallowed me up. Sleeves were also very long. But if you get it to work it’s super cute!
I know everyone has said it's too big, but genuinely this was unflattering too big. Not for me.

Wanted so badly for this dress to work :( Like other reviewers have said this dress is huge and runs way too big. The neckline is very low too and the dress loses the fun shape when oversized. Hung like a sack on me unfortunately
Sadly this dress was just too big all over. The sleeves were wayyy too long on me so I couldn’t wear it.
Size down at least one size. The sleeves were super long. Pretty color!

links_reviews_title: Runs big with super long arms - size down 2 sizes
links_reviews_text: Heavier than I expected. Great quality, but the weight makes it less flowy and more bag-gy. I have really long fingers and the ends of the sleeves went 4 inches past the ends of my fingers.

If you want an LBD with a little more coverage, this is a great one to try! I'd already worn it in another color a few months ago so I knew I liked it. It definitely runs a little large, but it's still flattering even if you're wearing a size larger than you think you might need. I got a lot of compliments in it and felt great while I wore it, so that's really all that matters!

Loved the color, sleeves and length of this dress. As other reviewers mentioned, it is quite oversized. I planned to wear this one belted, which looked super cute when I tried it on. I brought this dress on a trip, but am bummed that I ended up never wearing it. Would rent again to wear with a belt!

I got this from maternity suggestions and glad I did. It is elegant as a dress or with leggings and works in multiple climates. It is probably on the larger side if not expecting so plan appropriately
Love the color and style, but very flowy and loose
Great color, runs really big but the v-neck plunge was WAY too low for me. But I'm old...
Very cute dress but size down for sure. I sized down based on the reviews but this was still very roomy.
The color of this dress is beautiful but be careful - it is very, very low cut
Honestly the perfect dress on a day you’re feeling bloated!! Can be dressed up or down. Perfection!
Good holiday dress. It’s not wonderful for shorter people and it left a ton of cleavage out but it works with a cami underneath. I could still make it work.
I love the color

links_reviews_title: Order a size or two down!
links_reviews_text: Too big. Would have gone down a size, or two. Longer than expected.

Wore this for a baby shower, very flattering and received so many compliments, but it ran a tad bit big. I'm 5'6" and went with a small based on the other reviews, but honestly could have gone with an XS for a better fit.
This dress was great quality material, definitely fit larger than expected but I belted it and it was perfect. I wore it with booties and a leather jacket for a night out look.

This dress is so cute, but I couldn't wear it because it was so loose. I sized down, so I recommend sizing down by two sizes -- which will still give you the loose style of the dress, but you won't be swimming in it.

Super cute dress and comfy! The only thing is that it's super roomy and kind of long (like all free people things) especially if you're petite. Looks really cute with a belt on though, and makes it look more balanced. I loved wearing this to my friend's birthday dinner :)

links_reviews_title: Cute! but didnt care for the sleeves
links_reviews_text: Was cute and wore once. Guess I didn't care for the bell sleeves because my hands always get lost in them. If it had different sleeves and softer fabric would have purchased. The fabric was a little bit rough, but it draped nicely. Runs true to FP size.

links_reviews_title: Too short to for a dress, too long for a tunic
links_reviews_text: I liked this piece in theory, but was a little confused by the length. Ideal as a beach cover up length, but not really to wear about town. I don't really have a huge torso and I didn't run into the shortening problem as with most dresses when you have a large bum. It was plenty roomy it was just an awkward length. As a result I often wore this as a layered tunic with a mock neck under. It worked but wasn't quite the right length for that either. It's a cute piece but very heavy and a lot of fabric and ultimately just a bit too fussy for me.

I wore this dress a few times and was hoping it would fit more like the mannequin. I'm tall and relatively busty and this dress was massive on me. I added a belt with it to give a more fitted appearance. If you are short and/or petite I would not recommend as it has a lot of excess fabric.
Wore this for two nicer dinners and got lots of compliments. It was a little more low-cut than I bargained for, so I didn't get to wear it as much as I'd hoped.
Was basically a smock.

Love this dress! Super easy to travel with due to the pleated material doesn’t wrinkle. Belted it looks so flattering! A good length too for the daytime, not too short like most dresses for my curvy figure. Could live in this!
It just hangs. It comes down very low, so you have to be careful about moving and not showing too much the whole time.
This dress was so flattering and really cute! Size down because it is really flowy. I have longer legs and it wasn’t too short on me at all. Loved and will definitely rent in other colors!
This dress fit like a potato sack, even with a belt. Was 3 sizes too large to even wear out in public. I ordered a small after reading the reviews and it still swamped me.
This dress would have been cute if it wasn’t so big. The pleating was beautiful but it ended up looking like a low cut sack

I loved the color of this dress but would recommend sizing down. I belted the dress to try and help with the sizing issue, but the sleeves were just too long and the chest area too loose for the dress to really be functional for me.
I loved this piece. I can’t wait to rent it again in one of the other colors. I usual wear a small but sized down and it fit perfectly including the length.
The cut of this dress is so flattering, adorable belted or left hanging loose. It does run a bit oversized but was part of style. Would consider adding this onto a future order!
Loved this. Very comfortable . Wore with a pair of docs for a night out. Super fun. Fit is loose and larger.
It was too big on me. I would get it in S.

I loved this dress! I normally would be a medium but I took the other reviewers' advice and sized down which was definitely the move. I would have been swimming in a medium but the small hung just right and was perfect for work into a night out.

Liked the style, but I suggest sizing down a size or two - ran very, very large! It's the style dress that I'd rather wear smaller than larger anyways (since the style is meant to be loose), so definitely reco sizing down.
I know to size down for free people but it was still too large

This dress is beautiful and the fit is perfect. It runs a little big, but I like the oversized look and it wasn't unflattering. It's thick material and I can see it being scratchy to some people, but it didn't bother me. Wish I could've bought this one!
